citations.narrative:
The written program of veterinary care (PVC) for dogs is not complete or signed by the attending veterinarian. There is no
plan for sampling and treatment of blood parasites or external/internal parasites, including the number of animals to be
sampled. Additionally, there are no details concerning preventative care and treatment addressing any issues with the
haircoat, nails, eyes, ears, skin, and teeth. Following the guidance of the attending veterinarian in a complete written
program for these aspects of preventative care as well as parasite sampling and treatment ensures the dogs are receiving
adequate veterinary care. A complete, written PVC for dogs must be developed, documented in writing and signed by the
attending veterinarian. The program must include all of the required components as listed in the Animal Welfare Act and
Animal Welfare Regulations, Part 3, Subpart A, Section 3.13.
Correct by 10/04/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The written program of veterinary care (PVC) for dogs is not complete or signed by the attending veterinarian. There is no 
plan for sampling and treatment of blood parasites or external/internal parasites, including the number of animals to be 
sampled. Additionally, there are no details concerning preventative care and treatment addressing any issues with the 
haircoat, nails, eyes, ears, skin, and teeth. Following the guidance of the attending veterinarian in a complete written 
program for these aspects of preventative care as well as parasite sampling and treatment ensures the dogs are receiving 
adequate veterinary care. A complete, written PVC for dogs must be developed, documented in writing and signed by the 
attending veterinarian. The program must include all of the required components as listed in the Animal Welfare Act and 
Animal Welfare Regulations, Part 3, Subpart A, Section 3.13. 
 
Correct by 10/04/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
